title: Question 1
prompt:
Sentence 2: She started with us as a part-time receptionist and is later promoted to a full-time executive assistant.

Which is the best way to write the underlined portion of the sentence? If the original is the best way, choose option (A).
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: This is a question about verb tense. In a sentence, the verbs should all be in the same tense. The first verb in this sentence is “started.” Notice the –ed ending. That means the verb is in the past tense. The next verb, the one that this question is about, is in the present tense. That’s the verb “is.” Amanda is not promoted in the present. She was promoted in the past. There’s only one answer in the past tense, “was later promoted.”
